definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
counterrevolutionary coup of 12th April 1927, Chiang Kai-shek's coup against the communists in Shanghai
pinyin: si4 yi1 er4 fan3 ge2 ming4 zheng4 bian4

definition: coup by Dowager Empress Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4] ending the 1898 attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
unsuccessful and bloody Korean palace coup in 1884 by Westernisers against conservatives, crushed by Qing troops

sentences.english: China and Africa have long-lasting political instability, several mutinies and coups.
sentences.chinese: 中非政局曾長期持續動盪，多次發生兵變和政變。

sentences.english: After the Hundred Days' Reform, great changes took place in the ideological circle.
sentences.chinese: 戊戌政變後，思想界發生急劇變化。

sentences.english: Q. Dialogue with India was on while you were still in Rolpa, before the King's coup?
sentences.chinese: 在國王政變前，您始終在羅爾坡與印度對話嗎？

sentences.english: He was ousted in a coup two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他信兩年前在一次政變中被罷免。

sentences.english: The king accepted the coup that overthrew Mr Thaksin in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 國王認可了2006年推翻他信的那場政變。

sentences.english: Anti-coup activists rally in front of the Government House in Bangkok August 1, 2007 .
sentences.chinese: 反對政變的社會運動者在泰國曼谷政府大廈前集合。

sentences.english: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.chinese: 那君主被軍事政變者廢黜了。

sentences.english: Military coup d'état was a common political phenomenon in the history of African countries.
sentences.chinese: 軍事政變是非洲國家歷史上廣泛經歷的一種政治現象。

sentences.english: The unrests have killed 74 people and injured 530.
sentences.chinese: 截至目前，已有74人在政變中身亡，530人受傷。

sentences.english: He had been convicted of trying to overthrow the west African country's government in a coup.
sentences.chinese: 他被控告曾參與旨在推翻赤幾政府的未遂政變。

sentences.english: Coup plotters tried to seize power in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 政變密謀者試圖奪取莫斯科的政權。

sentences.english: Mr Gusm?o described the incident as a thwarted "coup".
sentences.chinese: 古斯芒先生把這個事件描述爲一次被挫敗的“政變”。

sentences.english: After the ’44 Putsch they arrested him.
sentences.chinese: 在44年的政變後，他們逮捕了他。

sentences.english: Kim Jong-Il conducted his own purges of the military to avoid a coup," Natsios said.
sentences.chinese: 爲了防止政變，金正日親自對軍方進行了清洗。

sentences.english: After the failure of the coup many of the rebels took to the hills and became guerillas .
sentences.chinese: 政變失敗後，許多反叛的人上山打游擊去了。

sentences.english: Should it be bankrolling coups in Latin America?
sentences.chinese: 美國是否應該資助拉美的政變？

definition: to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
